column4: how can imount a fat16 partition, like this??? sudo mount -t msdos /dev/sdaX /media/disc
how can i mount a fat16 partition, like this??? sudo mount -t msdos /dev/sdaX /media/disc
yep, you probably don't need the -t msdos part as mount should recognize it automagically.
yeah the thing is that it is not recognizing it, could the partition table or disc be corrupted?
what's the error message?
something like this... http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/58935/
it doesn't matter if i specify the filesystem or not, it shows the same message
vfat is fat32, you said the partition was fat16
i know, i tried doing it with msdos (the other was an example)
it does not matter if i use the -t option or no option, it shows the same message
ok, are you sure you have the correct partition?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/58936/
i was thinking that maybe that partition is corrupted or maybe the partition table...
ok, have you tried runnign ckfs on it?
nope, i will do it now, thanks ;)
sorry fsck
thanks i will do it know!
yw
if you're not sure, you can always image the partition and do whatever you want on the image file instead of the partition, that way you won't accidentally further corrupt stuff on the partition.
how do i do that?
dd if=/dev/hda6 of=/path/to/image/file
then you would need to use -oloop when mounting the image file
thanks i'll try that too ;)
just make sure you have enough space to create an image file which will hold the entire partition.
